title: olivierbeirs
author: olivierbeirs
content: âœ… Swape offers the ability to swap your crypto to other currencies. (No-KYC / Transaction limits)âš« Swape can also be used to mix your crypto, however for this we recommend switching networks (for complete anonymity), for example Ethereum -> Bitcoin.ðŸ’³ Swape will offer to transfer your crypto to a specific IBAN bank address (SEPA) later this year. (On request)https://swape.ioinfo@swape.io

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: I visited your website and did quick research. But i found few unsettling thing1. There's no lower/upper limit to swap. 2. It's new service. According to whois, the domain was registered on 2022-08-28[1].3. I checked Twitter page[2] and found out the interaction/comment doesn't look natural[3], where the reply either say "Done" or tagging other people.Sorry OP, but i have doubt about your service credibility.[1] https://who.is/whois/swape.io[2] https://twitter.com/swapeio[3] https://twitter.com/swapeio/status/1566157057736069120#m

comments.author: olivierbeirs
comments.body: Hi ETFbitcoin,I understand the vigilance, especially with new initiatives.1) There is a minimum limit (by the exchanges behind the website, KuCoin, Binance), but indeed no maximum limit yet. We don't expect high amounts through our exchange, but now that you've mentioned this, it might also be useful for trust if we set this. We'll look into that!2) Correct, we are completely new to the market.3) We hosted some giveaways at Crypto Twitter accounts, we tried to come into the spotlight through this, only in hindsight a lot of it seems to be bots.

comments.author: agentF
comments.body: Quote from: olivierbeirs on September 11, 2022, 10:48:12 AMâœ… Swape offers the ability to swap your crypto to other currencies. (No-KYC / Transaction limits)âš« Swape can also be used to mix your crypto, however for this we recommend switching networks (for complete anonymity), for example Ethereum -> Bitcoin.ðŸ’³ Swape will offer to transfer your crypto to a specific IBAN bank address (SEPA) later this year. (On request)https://swape.ioinfo@swape.ioHey,Could you explain the mechanism behind the Mixing?For example, chip mixer has a simple explanation of pre-made BTC wallets. How do you intend to send clean BTC or other tokens?Since you're offering token SWAP, any proof of funds? Where can we see your liquidity?

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.created_time: September 12, 2022, 10:23:00 AMLast edit: September 15, 2022, 10:11:28 AM by LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: olivierbeirs on September 11, 2022, 10:48:12 AMNo-KYC / Transaction limitsQuote from: olivierbeirs on September 11, 2022, 12:48:12 PM1) There is a minimum limit (by the exchanges behind the website, KuCoin, Binance)So how does that work? Someone sends you 1 Bitcoin, you send it to Binance, and exchange it there for whatever altcoin the user wants? Even if I ignore the fact that nobody should trust a website that was created just 2 weeks ago, how do you think Binance is going to handle non-KYC funds? Binance will seize your account, after which your "non KYC" service will turn into an exit scam.If you use centralized exchanges, you're not a mixer. They log everything.No honest exchange would claim there's no transaction limit. There's always a limit.I checked BestChange, and you'd end up on the lower end with the most expensive exchanges. Your site claims to be the "Cheapest crypto to crypto exchange" (in very large font). That's a lie. If you want people to trust you, you should never lie.I'm curious: why does your Trustpilot link go to the Dutch version, while your only review comes from someone who speaks Dutch? Did you write that by yourself?

comments.author: olivierbeirs
comments.body: Hi,Quote from: LoyceV on September 12, 2022, 10:23:00 AMSo how that that work? Someone sends you 1 Bitcoin, you send it to Binance, and exchange it there for whatever altcoin the user wants? Even if I ignore the fact that nobody should trust a website that was created just 2 weeks ago, how do you think Binance is going to handle non-KYC funds? Binance will seize your account, after which your "non KYC" service will turn into an exit scam.We have multiple KYC verified exchange accounts which are linked with the API to our website. Although I understand the doubts with a new website, less than 2 weeks old. Quote from: LoyceV on September 12, 2022, 10:23:00 AMIf you use centralized exchanges, you're not a mixer. They log everything.I agree, for the public, after a network switch, it's untraceable. But for the exchanges we use, it is indeed. I agree, we better not call it a mixer.Quote from: LoyceV on September 12, 2022, 10:23:00 AMNo honest exchange would claim there's no transaction limit. There's always a limit.There is a limit of $250,000 at a time, we have no limits per day/month. (Should be stated more clearly I think)Quote from: LoyceV on September 12, 2022, 10:23:00 AMI checked BestChange, and you'd end up on the lower end with the most expensive exchanges. Your site claims to be the "Cheapest crypto to crypto exchange" (in very large font). That's a lie. If you want people to trust you, you should never lie.Will adjust!Quote from: LoyceV on September 12, 2022, 10:23:00 AMI'm curious: why does your Trustpilot link go to the Dutch version, while your only review comes from someone who speaks Dutch? Did you write that by yourself?Swape.fyi/trustpilot indeed leads to 'nl.trustpilot.com', this has now been changed to `trustpilot.com`. This review was not posted by ourselves.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: olivierbeirs on September 12, 2022, 03:23:22 PMWe have multiple KYC verified exchange accounts which are linked with the API to our website.What if the exchange you're using pulls the it's tainted card? Obviously, there's no such thing as "tained Bitcoin", but Binance and other exchanges want to make people believe it exists. So what's your plan when that happens?Quote from: olivierbeirs on September 12, 2022, 03:23:22 PMQuote from: LoyceV on September 12, 2022, 10:23:00 AMI checked BestChange, and you'd end up on the lower end with the most expensive exchanges. Your site claims to be the "Cheapest crypto to crypto exchange" (in very large font). That's a lie. If you want people to trust you, you should never lie.Will adjust!Lol. Now you claim to be the "Fastest crypto to crypto exchange". I haven't tried it, but if you're using third party services, I doubt you're the fastest. I've seen an instant exchange accept a zero-fee deposit and instantly send the exchanged coins. I believe your current claim is most likely another lie.Maybe add some humor instead: "Newest crypto to crypto exchange" Can you share which country you're in? Depending on the country (and that's assuming your intentions are good), and if you indeed use several exchange accounts with your own KYC data, you could get so many legal problems from doing this.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: olivierbeirs on September 11, 2022, 10:48:12 AMâš« Swape can also be used to mix your crypto, however for this we recommend switching networks (for complete anonymity), for example Ethereum -> Bitcoin.I don't understand how your mixing works, so you should explain it better and show some proof that mixing really happened.Maybe also consider adding few more privacy coins on your website, if you really want to add mixing phrase.Quote from: olivierbeirs on September 11, 2022, 10:48:12 AMðŸ’³ Swape will offer to transfer your crypto to a specific IBAN bank address (SEPA) later this year. (On request)Is this going to be available also without passing KYC verification?And tell me what happens if coins I sent you for swap/mixing gets frozen on centralized exchange you are using as third party?Please name exactly all exchanges you are using.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: I don't seem to find your terms of service which is one of them most important aspects of run a service. Given that you are using opther exchanges to carry out exchanges and "mixing"Where do you stand from the legal point of view?What if Binance flags a suspicious transaction let's say from a hacked account, freezes the funds and then asks you to re-verify and prove the source of the funds, what do you do?

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Quote from: swape.ioNo transaction limitsMay I know your KYC levels on each exchange you use? IIRC, unlimited transactions on Binance can only be made by corporate accounts, not personal accounts. This raises concerns at some point.In addition, there are some exchanges that suspend accounts that have KYC for security reasons (of course) such as sudden high transactions, and they revoke your KYC status as if they no longer trust the identity documents you submitted previously.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on September 12, 2022, 11:38:47 PMWhat if Binance flags a suspicious transaction let's say from a hacked account, freezes the funds and then asks you to re-verify and prove the source of the funds, what do you do? Many instant exchanges that claim to not require KYC verification might be telling a partial truth in the sense that they don't need that verification themselves. But if you deposit coins to their wallet to make a swap, you can be asked to undergo KYC. They justify this by saying, it's not our fault, it's our partner exchanges that are asking for your KYC info. To the end user it doesn't really matter. I have my doubts about OPs claims they are making these swaps through their own KYC-verified accounts. That means it's their name connected to the coins being deposited. If I deposit stolen or hacked crypto, it's not me who did it, it's them. I don't see this working successfully for them or their users.
